JOB DESCRIPTION AND POSITION REQUIREMENTS: We are searching for a self-motivated, customer service oriented, and quality conscious person who is interested in a part-time opportunity. This opportunity will be assisting our Archivist and Records Specialist within the Information Technology Services Division, located in the Enterprise Operations Office of the Applied Research Laboratory (ARL) at Penn State University. ARL/Penn States purpose is to research and develop innovative solutions to challenging scientific, engineering, and technology problems in support of the Navy, the Department of Defense (DoD), and the Intel Community (IC). ARL is an authorized DoD SkillBridge partner and welcomes all transitioning military members to apply. Reporting directly to ARLs Archivist, you will: Acquire, analyze, categorize, catalog, and maintain information or artifacts using descriptive metadata throughout the archivist collections and databases (JIRA, SQL) and internal websites (Atlassian) Inventory and maintain collections of documentation, data, external reports, and specialized archival collections in unclassified and classified formats Ensure safe practices for the custodianship, physical storage, and preservation of collections and all archival safes Ensure compliance with existing contracts/security requirements within archives and records Respond to requests, questions, and issues, ranging from routine to moderately complex, regarding sensitive records and information, as well as ARL/University policies, processes, and procedures Educate stakeholders and conduct presentations regarding archival and records management processes Assist with preparation and facilitation of yearly DoD and NATO security inspections Assist with internal audits of classified holdings within the archives collections Track and generate monthly reporting metrics Keep abreast of new developments, technologies, and products to facilitate digitization processes Assist Penn State University Libraries and Records offices to promote a culture that is conducive to effective relationships among diverse team members Provide back-up support as needed Typically requires High School Diploma or higher and 3+ years related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Required skills/experience areas include: Proven success in an office environment, where various forms of communication and organizational skills were crucial to be effective Past experience working alongside a diverse group of people from a variety of cultures and backgrounds Preferred skills/experience areas include: Good understanding of collections management, digital archiving, and workflow processes Understanding of the Defense Industrial Base Active DoD security clearance Your working location can be hybrid on-site/work from home, located in State College, PA. This position may require periodic travel to locations surrounding the State College Area as part of collection retrieval or education. ARL at Penn State is an integral part of one of the leading research universities in the nation and serves as a University center of excellence in defense science, systems, and technologies with a focus in naval missions and related areas. Candidates selected will be subject to a government security investigation; you must be able to obtain a Top Secret Clearance. You must be a U.S. Citizen to apply. Employment with the Applied Research Laboratory will require successful completion of a pre-employment drug screen. ARL is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion; we believe this is central to our success as a Department of Defense designated University Affiliated Research Center (UARC). We are at our best when we draw on the talents of all parts of society, and our greatest accomplishments are achieved when diverse perspectives are part of our workforce.
